title: Drawing, "Frames"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Upper row: project and sketch for the cresting of a medallion frame: shape of a garland, with a bowknot. At right: plan of a molding. Center: upper left part of a molded oblong frame. Below: sketch of the oval frame. Probably drawn over it is a project for its crating, similar to above at left. Below at left is a sketch for the slopes of a garland. Colored background. Written in the upper right corner: "N 23".

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Frames".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-717.
